metadata.title: Introduction to JASP
metadata.description:
This video demonstrates the basic functionality of JASP.
 
Connect with JASP:
Website: https://jasp-stats.org
Twitter: https://twitter.com/JASPStats
Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/JASPStats
GitHub: https://github.com/jasp-stats/
 
Voiced by Gracia Edwards.
Text, editing and animations by Robbert de Vries.
metadata.author: JASP Statistics

chapters.title: Intro
chapters.text: this is jasp the free and user-friendly way to do statistics with jasp you can analyze your data and present your results in a simple and intuitive way using both classical frequentest and Bayesian analyzes

chapters.title: Data Library
chapters.text: intuitive way using both classical frequentest and Bayesian analyzes you can access your data set either locally on your computer or on the open science framework the data Library allows you to engage and play around with some pre-selected data sets

chapters.title: Primary Modules
chapters.text: and play around with some pre-selected data sets in the ribbon at the top you can see the primary modules which contain the most popular statistical analyzes in the social sciences in addition to your standard collection of classical frequentest analyzes jasp also offers their Beijing counterparts this way Jas promotes a more inclusive and informative approach to statistical inference

chapters.title: Advanced Modules
chapters.text: and informative approach to statistical inference in addition you can click on the plus sign in the upper right corner to add more modules you can also conduct more advanced analyzes in jasp for instance the same module based on the Levan package by E3 seal allows you to perform structural equation modeling in addition with our summary stats module you can re-analyze and examine published findings without needing the original data also you can engage with more advanced modules such as the machine learning module or network analysis module while you are conducting your analysis the changes you make are immediately reflected in the output panel on the right on the right your results will update in

chapters.title: UserFriendly
chapters.text: panel on the right on the right your results will update in real time this is just one example of how jasp is user-friendly and Interactive jasp was also designed to support many aspects of scientific work including writing an article or a report features in the output can be renamed as the labels and axes while titles and the Order of analyzes can be changed to that end with a few simple mouse clicks you can copy the tables in jasp and paste them into your word processor this way you have an APA style table with no fuss this copy paste functionality is also available for all of the plots in jasp moreover you can save the plots in standard file formats such as dot PNG or dot EPS to accompany your article submission

chapters.title: Open Science
chapters.text: dot EPS to accompany your article submission we aim to facilitate scientific openness and transparency this is why jasp makes it easy for you to reproduce and review the analyzes of your students collaborators and colleagues you can also annotate analyzes within jasp which allows you to create a record of the rationale behind your analyzes and give the proper interpretation of your results this benefits open science peer review and collaboration with colleagues it can also benefit teaching by encouraging concrete interaction with students

chapters.title: Data Sync
chapters.text: also benefit teaching by encouraging concrete interaction with students you can also edit your data file within jasp with the data sync feature you can access the raw data by double clicking on one of the cells in jasp for example you or your colleagues could add newly collected observations or add a new composite measure changes meant to the data are immediately reflected in your Jasper analyzes see the link in the description below for a separate data editing tutorial you can easily publish your just results directly to the open science framework and this allows other people to see your results without needing their own OSF account and without needing to install jasp on their machine see the link in the description below for a separate jasp OSF tutorial video

chapters.title: Languages
chapters.text: the description below for a separate jasp OSF tutorial video our team is constantly working to equip Jazz with new features and new state-of-the-art statistical analyzes working together with collaborators from all over the world jasp is now available in multiple languages such as German Spanish Portuguese and Chinese

chapters.title: Interactions
chapters.text: in multiple languages such as German Spanish Portuguese and Chinese when you visit our website jasp hyphenstats.org you can interact with the Jazz team in various ways first you can ask statistical questions on the jasp Forum second you can attend our annual summer workshop in Amsterdam the home of jasp third you can post feature requests and suggestions for improvement on the Jazz GitHub page and finally you can follow jasp on Twitter or on Facebook these are just some of the features that Jasper has to offer for in-depth tutorials subscribe to the Jazz YouTube channel or follow the link in the description to go to our website thanks for watching [Music]

segments.text: this is jasp the free and user-friendly
way to do statistics
with jasp you can analyze your data and
present your results in a simple and
intuitive way using both classical
frequentest and Bayesian analyzes
you can access your data set either
locally on your computer or on the open
science framework
the data Library allows you to engage
and play around with some pre-selected
data sets
in the ribbon at the top you can see the
primary modules which contain the most
popular statistical analyzes in the
social sciences
in addition to your standard collection
of classical frequentest analyzes jasp
also offers their Beijing counterparts
this way Jas promotes a more inclusive
and informative approach to statistical
inference
in addition you can click on the plus
sign in the upper right corner to add
more modules
you can also conduct more advanced
analyzes in jasp
for instance the same module based on
the Levan package by E3 seal allows you
to perform structural equation modeling
in addition with our summary stats
module you can re-analyze and examine
published findings without needing the
original data also you can engage with
more advanced modules such as the
machine learning module or network
analysis module while you are conducting
your analysis the changes you make are
immediately reflected in the output
panel on the right
on the right your results will update in
real time this is just one example of
how jasp is user-friendly and
Interactive
jasp was also designed to support many
aspects of scientific work including
writing an article or a report features
in the output can be renamed as the
labels and axes while titles and the
Order of analyzes can be changed
to that end with a few simple mouse
clicks you can copy the tables in jasp
and paste them into your word processor
this way you have an APA style table
with no fuss
this copy paste functionality is also
available for all of the plots in jasp
moreover you can save the plots in
standard file formats such as dot PNG or
dot EPS to accompany your article
submission
we aim to facilitate scientific openness
and transparency this is why jasp makes
it easy for you to reproduce and review
the analyzes of your students
collaborators and colleagues
you can also annotate analyzes within
jasp which allows you to create a record
of the rationale behind your analyzes
and give the proper interpretation of
your results
this benefits open science peer review
and collaboration with colleagues it can
also benefit teaching by encouraging
concrete interaction with students
you can also edit your data file within
jasp with the data sync feature
you can access the raw data by double
clicking on one of the cells in jasp for
example you or your colleagues could add
newly collected observations or add a
new composite measure
changes meant to the data are
immediately reflected in your Jasper
analyzes see the link in the description
below for a separate data editing
tutorial
you can easily publish your just results
directly to the open science framework
and this allows other people to see your
results without needing their own OSF
account and without needing to install
jasp on their machine see the link in
the description below for a separate
jasp OSF tutorial video
our team is constantly working to equip
Jazz with new features and new
state-of-the-art statistical analyzes
working together with collaborators from
all over the world jasp is now available
in multiple languages such as German
Spanish Portuguese and Chinese
when you visit our website jasp
hyphenstats.org you can interact with
the Jazz team in various ways first you
can ask statistical questions on the
jasp Forum second you can attend our
annual summer workshop in Amsterdam the
home of jasp third you can post feature
requests and suggestions for improvement
on the Jazz GitHub page and finally you
can follow jasp on Twitter or on
Facebook
these are just some of the features that
Jasper has to offer for in-depth
tutorials subscribe to the Jazz YouTube
channel or follow the link in the
description to go to our website thanks
for watching
[Music]

transcript.full_text: this is jasp the free and user-friendly way to do statistics with jasp you can analyze your data and present your results in a simple and intuitive way using both classical frequentest and Bayesian analyzes you can access your data set either locally on your computer or on the open science framework the data Library allows you to engage and play around with some pre-selected data sets in the ribbon at the top you can see the primary modules which contain the most popular statistical analyzes in the social sciences in addition to your standard collection of classical frequentest analyzes jasp also offers their Beijing counterparts this way Jas promotes a more inclusive and informative approach to statistical inference in addition you can click on the plus sign in the upper right corner to add more modules you can also conduct more advanced analyzes in jasp for instance the same module based on the Levan package by E3 seal allows you to perform structural equation modeling in addition with our summary stats module you can re-analyze and examine published findings without needing the original data also you can engage with more advanced modules such as the machine learning module or network analysis module while you are conducting your analysis the changes you make are immediately reflected in the output panel on the right on the right your results will update in real time this is just one example of how jasp is user-friendly and Interactive jasp was also designed to support many aspects of scientific work including writing an article or a report features in the output can be renamed as the labels and axes while titles and the Order of analyzes can be changed to that end with a few simple mouse clicks you can copy the tables in jasp and paste them into your word processor this way you have an APA style table with no fuss this copy paste functionality is also available for all of the plots in jasp moreover you can save the plots in standard file formats such as dot PNG or dot EPS to accompany your article submission we aim to facilitate scientific openness and transparency this is why jasp makes it easy for you to reproduce and review the analyzes of your students collaborators and colleagues you can also annotate analyzes within jasp which allows you to create a record of the rationale behind your analyzes and give the proper interpretation of your results this benefits open science peer review and collaboration with colleagues it can also benefit teaching by encouraging concrete interaction with students you can also edit your data file within jasp with the data sync feature you can access the raw data by double clicking on one of the cells in jasp for example you or your colleagues could add newly collected observations or add a new composite measure changes meant to the data are immediately reflected in your Jasper analyzes see the link in the description below for a separate data editing tutorial you can easily publish your just results directly to the open science framework and this allows other people to see your results without needing their own OSF account and without needing to install jasp on their machine see the link in the description below for a separate jasp OSF tutorial video our team is constantly working to equip Jazz with new features and new state-of-the-art statistical analyzes working together with collaborators from all over the world jasp is now available in multiple languages such as German Spanish Portuguese and Chinese when you visit our website jasp hyphenstats.org you can interact with the Jazz team in various ways first you can ask statistical questions on the jasp Forum second you can attend our annual summer workshop in Amsterdam the home of jasp third you can post feature requests and suggestions for improvement on the Jazz GitHub page and finally you can follow jasp on Twitter or on Facebook these are just some of the features that Jasper has to offer for in-depth tutorials subscribe to the Jazz YouTube channel or follow the link in the description to go to our website thanks for watching [Music]
